title: Why pick Ashe when you have Kalista?
body:
Why ever pick ashe anymore? Seriously!? 

Think about it, in nearly every conceivable way {{champion:429}} 's kit poops  all over {{champion:22}}  and not just a little bit, but from a birds eye view. 
{{champion:22}}  used to be the kitting queen,  and that was the entire reason why she was picked ( if ever ). Her kite potential balanced out the fact she didnt have a dash which made sense but now we have the same kite potential (if not better) on {{champion:429}}  with not just "A" dash but one every auto attack? 

Their ults are arguably on par with each other in terms of general use and utility (being probably the two best adc ultimates in game) so I wont go there but if {{champion:22}}  was meant to be the best for kiting she just isn't anymore.

replies.body: Because pre level 30 and bronze/silver players would probably make better use out of Ashe.
I agree as well.  Ashe is a nice striaght forward champ to learn, but her competitiveness is seriously lacking and i think most ppl know it.

I'd have to agree with this to an extent. Most pre 30s, bronze and silver players probably couldn't do as well on Kalista as they could on Ashe. Though I seem to be able to do better on Kalista than Ashe, might be because I have a fabulous support though.

Please don't ever compare ADC's each has their own strengths and weaknesses. Ashe for example has a 3s stun, if hit across the map, which also does AoE damage. Her vision grants her bonus gold and course her passive will absolute dominate early game poke with a guaranteed critical hit. As well as a volley on a low cooldown, and is AoE and slows. Ashe is still the kiting Queen and she always will be unless her kit is altered.

Ashe doesnt have a 3s stun. She has the potential for a 3 second stun... Theres a HUGE difference. The damage on her Ult is not all that impressive either. Its the utility and instant use of her ult to change a battle that makes it good.  Kalista's ult is arguably as useful in different ways... 

Ashe's gold bonus is good and so is her passive but both are non-consequential in later game teamfights which is when an ADC is meant to shine.  Her W is her real saving grace but past that her normal AA range brings her into most brusier dash/gap closer's so she instantly needs to gain distance again.... blowing an ult or a flash or something. 
She  needs a heavy front line wall for her to be useful. She needs to be built around and thats the problem

Maybe saying it like I did gave the wrong impression of what I meant but 200 Cs and 600 more gold doesn't make her kite any easier.

its not really fair to make this comparison, its like saying "why pick urgot when you could pick Master Yi cos he %%%%s on every other champ"
you cant just take the currently most op adc and compare her with an extremely balanced adc and say the balanced one is %%%% cos they cant keep up with the broken one.

It is very much fair to make this comparison. I don't understnad how new champions instantly get a free pass when they are released in an overpowered state. Thats really not an excuse...
And BTW when I say overpowered i mean overpowered relative to a champion that is also known for her kiting, I dont personally think Kalista is OP.... I think Ashe has become once again underwhelming now that her kiting potential has been superseded.

PLus this isn't a comparison between apples and oranges here.... they are both very similiar ADCs. They both are very kite reliant, they both have a poke, they both have the potential for a CC ultimate to varying degrees.
When you have Classical and Death Metal which would a true man choose?
K pop

Ashe has the ability to slow groups of enemies at once, as she has an AoE spell. She can slow pretty much whenever she wants. Even if she can't kite as good as Kalista, the fact that she  has an always readily available slow can be better. Plus, Ashe can help her teammates wherever she is. Ashe works better in some situations than Kalista. Anyway, a person who can kite well as Ashe but isn't accustomed to Kalista's passive would probably be best playing Ashe against a comp which they need to kite.
I don't think you can just say one is better than the other, as they both have situations in which each are better. Look at your comps, I suppose, then decide which would be better. Plus, there is personal preference.
